result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant Eric James Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Reckless Driving-Endanger Safety. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Deferred Judgment in effect for Count 3 , 961.41(3g)(b) Possession of Controlled Substance for the duration of this term of probation per 961.47 of Wisconsin Statutes. Defendant is to comply in Count 3 with all of the probation conditions in Count 1. If Probation is successfully completed with all conditions met, Count 3 to be dismissed.

Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.

Defendant is to make all mental health/treatment records available to agent to allow for follow up.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  
Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
